intro: Deinandra simplex, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, spiny fruits are designed for wind dispersal, aiding in its propagation across dry landscapes. Deinandra simplex is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
